item.description:
This is a general Collection for P21 API Calls. 

The main call in here is to get the bearer token.

item.name: Entity Rest  Services - Old REST API Calls

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<Contact xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
	<ContactLinks>
        <ContactLink>
            <!--Enter Cutomer ID Below-->
            <ContactLinkId>177107</ContactLinkId>
            <ContactType>1203</ContactType>
            <!--Be sure to enter your Company ID-->
            <CompanyId>1</CompanyId>
        </ContactLink>
    </ContactLinks>
  <Salutation/>
  <FirstName>{{$randomFirstName}}</FirstName>
  <Mi />
  <LastName>{{$randomLastName}}</LastName>
  <Title>{{$randomJobTitle}}</Title>
  <AddressId>177107</AddressId>
  <Mailstop/>
  <NoOfCycleDays>0</NoOfCycleDays>
  <Comments>{{$randomLoremSentence}}</Comments>
  <DirectPhone/>
  <PhoneExt/>
  <DirectFax/>
  <FaxExt/>
  <Beeper/>
  <Cellular/>
  <Class1id/>
  <Class2id/>
  <Class3id/>
  <Class4id/>
  <Class5id/>
  <HomeAddress1>{{$randomStreetAddress}}</HomeAddress1>
  <HomeAddress2/>
  <HomePhone>{{$randomPhoneNumber}}</HomePhone>
  <HomeFax/>
  <HomeEmailAddress/>
  <Birthday xsi:nil="true" />
  <Anniversary xsi:nil="true" />
  <EmailAddress>{{$randomEmail}}</EmailAddress>
  <Url/>
  <CellularExt/>
  <Id/>
</Contact>

request.description: This is an old call to create a contact ID in P21 and link it with a Customer ID.

body.raw:
<ArrayOfItemPriceInfo>
    <ItemPriceInfo>
        <ItemId>10643-8-8</ItemId>
        <SourceLocId>{{LocationID}}</SourceLocId>
        <!--<CustomerPartNo>String content</CustomerPartNo>-->
        <UnitQuantity>1</UnitQuantity>
        <UnitSize>1</UnitSize>
        <UOM>EA</UOM>
        <!--<PriceUom>String content</PriceUom>-->
  
    </ItemPriceInfo>
    <!--
        This is a sample item xml structure
        You can add ass many items as you want, just add an; 'ItemPriceInfo' for each item
        Note: the more items you add the longer the API Call might take
    -->
    <ItemPriceInfo>
        <ItemId>[this can be any valid item id]</ItemId>
        <SourceLocId>{{LocationID}}</SourceLocId>
        <!--<CustomerPartNo>String content</CustomerPartNo>-->
        <UnitQuantity>1</UnitQuantity>
        <UnitSize>1</UnitSize>
        <UOM>EA</UOM>
        <!--<PriceUom>String content</PriceUom>-->
  
    </ItemPriceInfo>
</ArrayOfItemPriceInfo>

request.description: This call will return the P21 Inv Mast UID for any part in P21.

item.name: Get a Task based on ID

item.description:
These are calls against he old REST P21 API. They are older, and might eventually be depcrecated, but as of now are currently working. 

They are included as they help get an understanding of API calls, and are also relatively simple to use. 

They are not recommended for large projects or a tool that might be mission critical, but are a great starting point.

Note: Dynachange rules, or business logic will not generally impact these.

item.name: Transaction API (AKA: V2 API)
XML Calls

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<TransactionSet xmlns="http://schemas.datacontract.org/2004/07/P21.Transactions.Model.V2" xmlns:i="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <!--The Name provided relates to the 'Window' under which you are trying to call-->
    <Name>Order</Name>
    <Transactions>
        <Transaction>
            <DataElements>
                <!--
                The DataElement needs to be passed for each 'Tab' in P21 for which you want to enter data. For example for orders you will always need the header tab, and the line items tab.
                In the example below the 'tp_contacts' tab is also passed due to the fact that in our system a Contact ID is required to create an order/quote.                
                -->
                <DataElement>
                    <Keys xmlns:a="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"/>
                    <Name>TABPAGE_1.order</Name>
                    <Rows>
                        <Row>
                            <Edits>
                            	<Edit>
                                    <!--
                                        This controls whether or not it is a quote or an order 
                                        ON - Means it will be a Quote
                                        OFF - Means it will be an Order
                                    -->
				                	<Name>quote</Name>
				                	<Value>OFF</Value>
				                </Edit>
                                <!--This needs to be a valid ShipTo ID-->
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>ship_to_id</Name>
                                    <Value>177107</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>po_no</Name>
                                    <Value>{{$randomLoremSlug}}</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                <!--
                                    Optional: This can be set, but is not required.
                                    If not provided then the API credentials will be used as a default.
                                    Generally a good practice to set, but it must be a valid Taker in the system. 
                                -->
                                <Edit>
                                	<Name>taker</Name>
                                	<Value>fmaurer</Value>
                                </Edit>
                            </Edits>
                            <RelativeDateEdits/>
                        </Row>
                    </Rows>
                    <Type>Form</Type>
                </DataElement>
                <!-- This DataElement is not generally required, but we have a Screen Designer cahnge that requires it, so it is included here. -->
                <DataElement>
                    <Keys xmlns:a="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"/>
                    <Name>tp_contacts.tp_contacts</Name>
                    <Rows>
                        <Row>
                            <Edits>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>first_name</Name>
                                    <Value>{{$randomFirstName}}</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>last_name</Name>
                                    <Value>{{$randomLastName}}</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>email_address</Name>
                                    <Value>{{$randomEmail}}</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                <!--
                                    This is a User Defined field that in our (Hydradyne) is required in the contacts tab.
                                    It is commented out so it does not impact other users making the call, but left here to give an example of hwo a user defined field can be added to a call
                                -->
                                
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>ufc_contacts_ud_contact_type</Name>
                                    <Value>1 Customer Buyer</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                
                            </Edits>
                            <RelativeDateEdits/>
                        </Row>
                    </Rows>
                    <Type>Form</Type>
                </DataElement>
                <!-- This DataElement is for the line items. We cant create orders without line items. -->
                <DataElement>
                    <Keys xmlns:a="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"/>
                    <Name>TP_ITEMS.items</Name>
                    <Rows>
                        <!--
                            To add multiple items copy the 'Row' Element and add multiple Rows
                            
                            Note: If you need to add the same Item ID to an order multiple times this call needs to be tweaked a bit. This example does not cover that scenario. 
                        -->
                        <Row>
                            <Edits>
                                <!--
                                    Item ID needs to Exist
                                 -->
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>oe_order_item_id</Name>
                                    <Value>10643-8-8</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>unit_quantity</Name>
                                    <Value>1.000000000</Value>
                                </Edit>

                                <!-- Optional Field -->
								<Edit>
						          <Name>required_date</Name>
						          <Value>11/20/2019</Value>
						        </Edit>

                            </Edits>
                            <RelativeDateEdits/>
                        </Row>
                    </Rows>
                    <Type>List</Type>
                </DataElement>
            </DataElements>
            <Status>New</Status>
        </Transaction>
    </Transactions>
    <UseCodeValues>false</UseCodeValues>
</TransactionSet>

request.description: This is a simple Order Creation API call with the Transaction API (sometimes also referred to as 'V2 API')

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<TransactionSet xmlns="http://schemas.datacontract.org/2004/07/P21.Transactions.Model.V2" xmlns:i="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <!--The Name provided relates to the 'Window' under which you are trying to call-->
    <Name>Order</Name>
    <Transactions>
        <Transaction>
            <DataElements>
                <!--
                The DataElement needs to be passed for each 'Tab' in P21 for which you want to enter data. For example for orders you will always need the header tab, and the line items tab.
                In the example below the 'tp_contacts' tab is also passed due to the fact that in our system a Contact ID is required to create an order/quote.                
                -->
                <DataElement>
                    <Keys xmlns:a="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"/>
                    <Name>TABPAGE_1.order</Name>
                    <Rows>
                        <Row>
                            <Edits>
                            	<Edit>
                                    <!--
                                        This controls whether or not it is a quote or an order 
                                        ON - Means it will be a Quote
                                        OFF - Means it will be an Order
                                    -->
				                	<Name>quote</Name>
				                	<Value>OFF</Value>
				                </Edit>
                                <!--This needs to be a valid ShipTo ID-->
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>ship_to_id</Name>
                                    <Value>177107</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>po_no</Name>
                                    <Value>{{$randomLoremSlug}}</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                <!--
                                    Optional: This can be set, but is not required.
                                    If not provided then the API credentials will be used as a default.
                                    Generally a good practice to set, but it must be a valid Taker in the system. 
                                -->
                                <Edit>
                                	<Name>taker</Name>
                                	<Value>fmaurer</Value>
                                </Edit>
                            </Edits>
                            <RelativeDateEdits/>
                        </Row>
                    </Rows>
                    <Type>Form</Type>
                </DataElement>
                <!-- This DataElement is not generally required, but we have a Screen Designer cahnge that requires it, so it is included here. -->
                <DataElement>
                    <Keys xmlns:a="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"/>
                    <Name>tp_contacts.tp_contacts</Name>
                    <Rows>
                        <Row>
                            <Edits>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>first_name</Name>
                                    <Value>{{$randomFirstName}}</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>last_name</Name>
                                    <Value>{{$randomLastName}}</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>email_address</Name>
                                    <Value>{{$randomEmail}}</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                <!--
                                    This is a User Defined field that in our (Hydradyne) is required in the contacts tab.
                                    It is commented out so it does not impact other users making the call, but left here to give an example of hwo a user defined field can be added to a call
                                -->
                                
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>ufc_contacts_ud_contact_type</Name>
                                    <Value>1 Customer Buyer</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                
                            </Edits>
                            <RelativeDateEdits/>
                        </Row>
                    </Rows>
                    <Type>Form</Type>
                </DataElement>
                <!-- This DataElement is for the line items. We cant create orders without line items. -->
                <DataElement>
                    <Keys xmlns:a="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"/>
                    <Name>TP_ITEMS.items</Name>
                    <Rows>
                        <!--
                            To add multiple items copy the 'Row' Element and add multiple Rows
                            
                            Note: If you need to add the same Item ID to an order multiple times this call needs to be tweaked a bit. This example does not cover that scenario. 
                        -->
                        <Row>
                            <Edits>
                                <!--
                                    Item ID needs to Exist
                                 -->
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>oe_order_item_id</Name>
                                    <Value>10643-8-8</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>unit_quantity</Name>
                                    <Value>1.000000000</Value>
                                </Edit>

                                <!-- Optional Field -->
								<Edit>
						          <Name>required_date</Name>
						          <Value>11/20/2019</Value>
						        </Edit>

                            </Edits>
                            <RelativeDateEdits/>
                        </Row>
                    </Rows>
                    <Type>List</Type>
                </DataElement>
            </DataElements>
            <Status>New</Status>
        </Transaction>
    </Transactions>
    <UseCodeValues>false</UseCodeValues>
</TransactionSet>

request.description: This is a simple Order Creation API call with the Transaction API (sometimes also referred to as 'V2 API')

body.raw:
<TransactionSet xmlns="http://schemas.datacontract.org/2004/07/P21.Transactions.Model.V2" xmlns:i="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <Name>Order</Name>
    <Transactions>
        <Transaction>
            <DataElements>
                <DataElement>
                    <Keys xmlns:a="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"></Keys>
                    <Name>TABPAGE_1.order</Name>
                    <Rows>
                        <Row>
                            <Edits>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>order_no</Name>
                                    <!-- Be sure to give a valid order number -->
                                    <Value>11686367</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>cancel_flag</Name>
                                    <Value>N</Value>
                                </Edit>
                            </Edits>
                        </Row>
                    </Rows>
                    <Type>Form</Type>
                </DataElement>
                
            </DataElements>
            <Documents i:nil="true"/>
            <Status>New</Status>
        </Transaction>
    </Transactions>
    <UseCodeValues>false</UseCodeValues>
</TransactionSet>

request.description: Very simple call to cancel an order or quote in P21.

body.raw:
<TransactionSet xmlns="http://schemas.datacontract.org/2004/07/P21.Transactions.Model.V2" xmlns:i="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <Name>Order</Name>
    <Transactions>
        <Transaction>
            <DataElements>
                <DataElement>
                    <Keys xmlns:a="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"></Keys>
                    <Name>TABPAGE_1.order</Name>
                    <Rows>
                        <Row>
                            <Edits>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>order_no</Name>
                                    <!-- Be sure to give a valid order number -->
                                    <Value>11962889</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>oe_hdr_ship2_add1</Name>
                                    <Value>{{$randomStreetAddress}}</Value>
                                </Edit>
                            </Edits>
                        </Row>
                    </Rows>
                    <Type>Form</Type>
                </DataElement>
                <DataElement>
                    <Keys xmlns:a="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"></Keys>
                    <Name>TP_SHIPINFO.shipinfo</Name>
                    <Rows>
                        <Row>
                            <Edits>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>oe_hdr_carrier_id</Name>
                                    <Value>Best Way</Value>
                                </Edit>
                            </Edits>
                        </Row>
                    </Rows>
                    <Type>Form</Type>
                </DataElement>
                
                <DataElement>
                    <Keys xmlns:a="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"/>
                    <Name>TP_ITEMS.items</Name>
                    <Rows>
                        <!--
                            To add multiple items copy the 'Row' Element and add multiple Rows
                            
                            Note: If you need to add the same Item ID to an order multiple times this call needs to be tweaked a bit. This example does not cover that scenario. 
                        -->
                        <Row>
                            <Edits>
                                <!--
                                    Item ID needs to Exist
                                 -->
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>oe_order_item_id</Name>
                                    <Value>10643-8-10</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>unit_quantity</Name>
                                    <Value>1.000000000</Value>
                                </Edit>

                                <!-- Optional Field -->
								<Edit>
						          <Name>required_date</Name>
						          <Value>11/20/2019</Value>
						        </Edit>

                            </Edits>
                            <RelativeDateEdits/>
                        </Row>
                    </Rows>
                    <Type>List</Type>
                </DataElement>
            </DataElements>
            <Documents i:nil="true"/>
            <Status>New</Status>
        </Transaction>
    </Transactions>
    <UseCodeValues>false</UseCodeValues>
</TransactionSet>

request.description: This is a call to update an order.

body.raw:
<TransactionSet xmlns="http://schemas.datacontract.org/2004/07/P21.Transactions.Model.V2" xmlns:i="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <Name>Order</Name>
    <Transactions>
        <Transaction>
            <DataElements>
                <DataElement>
                    <Keys xmlns:a="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"></Keys>
                    <Name>TABPAGE_1.order</Name>
                    <Rows>
                        <Row>
                            <Edits>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>order_no</Name>
                                    <!-- Be sure to give a valid order number -->
                                    <Value>11962846</Value>
                                </Edit>
                                <!--<Edit>
                                    <Name>oe_hdr_ship2_add1</Name>
                                    <Value>{{$randomStreetAddress}}</Value>
                                </Edit>-->
                            </Edits>
                        </Row>
                    </Rows>
                    <Type>Form</Type>
                </DataElement>
                <DataElement>
                    <Keys xmlns:a="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"></Keys>
                    <Name>TP_FRONTCOUNTER.tp_frontcounter</Name>
                    <Rows>
                        <Row>
                            <Edits>
                                <Edit>
                                    <Name>email_orderack</Name>
                                    <Value>ON</Value>
                                </Edit>
                            </Edits>
                        </Row>
                    </Rows>
                    <Type>Form</Type>
                </DataElement>
            </DataElements>
            <Documents i:nil="true"/>
            <Status>New</Status>
        </Transaction>
    </Transactions>
    <UseCodeValues>false</UseCodeValues>
</TransactionSet>

item.name: JSON Calls

request.description: This is a simple call to create a Price Book
This is a call that creates a price page
This call adds a price page to a Pricing Book
This call can create or update an assembly item.

This is an API call that will move inventory from one bin to another bin.

The benefit of this call is that it leverages the 'Key' functionality in the API, which allows for one row in a list to be moved without affecting all the rows.

This call will create a Customer or prospect in P21.

Note: Call probably need heavy customization if other companies intend to use it. Hydradyne has a customization that allows for commission splits, which requires a salesrep by location to be added to the customer.

item.description:
Call in this folder were created using JSON calls. 

Note: Json does not allow for comments, so these API calls generally have no comments.

request.description:
This is a GREAT call to make to get all the available services for the Transaction API.

It will return a list of all available services.
Use this combined with e 'Get Defaults - Orders' API call to get the defaults of any service
This call gets the default values for the Order Window. It is a sample of the 'Get Defaults - {{WindowName}}' Call.
This is a blank call that uses the {{WindowName}} as a variable. Used in combination with the 'Get Available Services' Call.

item.description:
Each DataElement represents a tab within the window. It contains the following information:

    Name: This uniquely identifies the tab of the window.
    Type: This is the type of the window i.e. Form, List or Other.
    Keys: This is a list of string which represents key columns to identify the unique row for List (list contains multiple row). This information is always available with the template and field definition through above request (Step 2).
    Rows: Represents list of Row. Each Row will contains Edits which represents fields (columns) for the row/record and RelativeDataEdits which contains information about the relative date.
    Edits: Represents list of Edit containing Name and Value.

item.name: Data Services API

request.description:
This is a great call to get an idea of what views can be queried from P21.

Not all views in the database have been made accessible (Additional views and custom views cannot be currently added here).

item.name: Get Data for Lines of an Quote/Order
Get Tasks via Query API calls

request.description:
This is a sample call that has a query in it.

It will return all tasks based on the query.

url.raw: {{Endpoint}}data/erp/views/v1/p21_view_customer?$top=10&$filter=last_check_amount lt 200 and last_check_date ne null&$orderby=last_check_date&$select=last_check_amount, last_check_date, customer_name

query.value: last_check_amount lt 200 and last_check_date ne null

request.description:
The true power comes from mixing and matching capabilities! 

The Parameters passed in this call show the full capabilities of this API, and how it can be leveraged to pull allot of data very quickly.

This call returns the top 10 Deleted Customers.

It only returns a few fields, but the $select parameter can be removed and all data from the view will be returned.

item.description:
This is the Data Services Endpoint. A fairly fast set of API calls that are good for pulling data.



Per Epicor: 
Overview
The Middleware now includes an Open Data Protocol (OData) v3 feed for ERP data. The Data Service provides stable, fast querying capability against defined views in the ERP database without exposing your Enterprise database server directly to the consumers.

When To Use
Use the OData Data Service when you need quick read-only access to defined views in the system. OData is typically consumed by an application or client capable of understanding OData v3 protocol (syntax).
